intro: Erigeron orizabensis, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces showy white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron orizabensis is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
